intro: Vaupelia macranthera, commonly known as the large-flowered vaupelia, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that bear large, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and prefers well-drained soils. Vaupelia macranthera is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in warm climates.
